Articles.Content:
Hey everyone, 

I recently made a beautiful replica of SpaceX new Starship and Superheavy (picture pending). The superheavy doesn't get recovered (you can only control 1 spaceship at a time), but the Starship will. I have managed to map the flaps to the WASDQE-controls and it actually works! However... 

The controls are not mapped to the SAS, so I need to do all the flying myself. Quite a hassle, especially when you play with the amount of lag I'm playing with. So, here's my question: is there any way to map the controls to the SAS? 

Here's an image of the Starship's version of The Everyday Astronaut: https://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1175955003758055425/pu/img/YGsfeLorrjIWtU-T.jpg

1 hour ago, Lars_vS said:

The controls are not mapped to the SAS, so I need to do all the flying myself. Quite a hassle, especially when you play with the amount of lag I'm playing with. So, here's my question: is there any way to map the controls to the SAS? 

I'm not sure what you mean here. Could you describe what you're expecting and what's happening instead?

Yes, of course! 

When I try to land the ship, the four flaps work as intended when I control the ship. SAS doesn't do anything (except for things like the reaction wheels of course). 

What I want: SAS controls the flaps too to pitch, yaw and roll the ship in the desired direction (set in the SAS-system, e.g. radial out). 

So everything does what it's supposed to do, I just want the SAS to control the flaps, too.

Nope, that doesn't work. And you are not the first one to be annoyed by this, see the bugtracker issue #22946.

Feel free to upvote the issue on the bugtracker, that will increase the chance that it will be implemented before the heat-death of the universe.

[Edit:] You can also say that the yaw, pitch, roll, and the 3 translate custom axes behave like custom control axes that just happen to be mapped to the same keys as the yaw, pitch, roll, and translate commands.

Edited May 17, 2020 by AHHans
